intro: Myrsine venosa var. catharinensis, commonly known as the Brazilian myrsine, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Brazil and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves that are often glossy and dark green. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in terminal inflorescences. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The berries it produces are typically red or black when mature and contain several small seeds.
